intro: Sesbania molokaiensis, commonly known as Molokai sesbania, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a legume belonging to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with erect or sprawling stems. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. Due to its restricted geographic range, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
